A: pours a hazy, gold body with a thick white head with excellent retention and lacing.
S: dank, earthy hop notes with some floral undertones.
T: excellent earthy hop notes with some sweet alcohol notes; subtle sweet lemongrass malt in the aftertaste.
M: medium bodied and smooth.
O: well balanced DIPA; excellent tasting and drinking beer.May 16, 2020', "4.25An excellent example of a double IPA. As balanced as a beer with an ABV exceeding 8% can be. There is a slight booziness here, but it's a pleasant one. There are plenty of other DIPAs that taste like boilermakers.May 08, 2020", '4-amber can pour with with a slight haze and a 2 cm foam cap. The aroma is slight with malt and spruce notes. The flavor is largely resin and grapefruit. There is a slight sweet aspect and low to moderate hop bitterness. There is no notable alcohol heat. -quite goodMay 01, 2020', '3.5Medium poured into a snifter from 12oz bottle. Small head about 1cm, gradually fades leaving a thin layer on top. Amber with enough haze to obstruct seeing clearly through. Smells of citrus and candy. Tastes of pine, citrus and sugar. Quite bitter, fairly hoppy of which I'm guessing is hop juice instead of whole. Leaves the palette wet and has a sort of thick quality about the viscosity. I don't know why it's rated "outstanding" on here. I've had about 100 IPA's that were better. It's okay at best.Mar 05, 2020', '4Pours a hazy light orange color with minimal head. Scent is of pine, citrus and sweet fruit. Taste starts more sweet, with pine and citrus kicking in at the midpoint. Medium-ish mouthfeel leading to a sweet/bitter aftertasteFeb 28, 2020', "4.25On tap at Lucy's, Ramada Inn. Just outstanding and a wonderful consolation prize for being assigned a project site in Baldwinsville NY. FML. Will hunt down for retail tomorrow. My Massachusetts peeps will pay homage.Jan 29, 2020", '4Canned 11/25/19 , from an Overpack'd 15pk. Wish it was a little fresher, but this is what's generally available, so fair enough. Let warm to 50F before pouring.

Deep amber-ish gold, with two-finger coarse off-white hed, that quickly dissipates to a 1/4" ring, and single-layer coverage across the whole surface. Slight spotty lacing.

Smell is typical old-school DIPA : smooth, rounded pine , dried citrus rind, with some floral and honey notes.

Taste is moderately bitter grapefruit and pine , tempered with a slightly sweet honey-on-toasted-cornbread-crust finish. A little pine and tang linger on the tongue, after finish.

Feel medium, with very fine sharp carbonation tingle late, that lingers a bit. Leaves a light syrup ycoating . 

Overall, not something I'd want all of the time, but enjoyable when I do have it. Having had this numerous times, I can say with some confidence that it's more citrusy when younger , then ages to something leaning more to the piney side, as it is now. Good either way.Jan 27, 2020', '4.25Amber colored beer with some white colored head. An excellent IPA.moderatly hoppy but not overalls hoppy. Smells hoppy but do not get too fooled it’s over hoppinessDec 07, 2019', "2L: Brownish tan, sort of a caramel burnt orange, with a big malt base.

S: Not a very strong aroma. I've really got to bury my nose in the glass. 

T: I don't like the taste. It's oily and resinous. That's about it. Somehow, with this many hops, it is not herbal. It is earthy at best.

F: Approachable (due to the distinct lack of fresh ingredients)

O: I don't know what Southern Tier expects to make happen with bland malts and hop pellets.Oct 14, 2019", "3.25Poured into a tulip glass from a can which was part of a mix pack. Unfortunately the can was date stamped over 2 months from the day I purchased. This is why I try to avoid buying mix packs but we had a group of people coming over and I hadn't had a lot of Southern Tier. If ST reads this you really shouldn't be putting hoppy DIPAs in mix packs that sit on supermarket and big box stores shelves. If affects the quality as well as your reputation.

So while I sure If I had this fresh on tap my experiences would be different but I have to go by what I drank and frankly it was pretty underwhelming. I expect way better from a DIPA. It was off tasting with no distinguishable aroma. Way too bitter than other DIPAs. I will be avoiding this going forward however I do enjoy other ST ales.Oct 02, 2019", '4Look - poured into a 12 oz tulip glass. Lemon golden in color, cloudy, with a moderate one-and-a-half finger head and good lacing.
Smell - dominated by citrus, complemented with a nice floral note. almost smells like freshly squeezed orange juice with a nice hoppy twist.
Taste - surprisingly clean. the citrus flavors come through, though with much more hoppiness than detected in the smell. bitterness of hops linger for quite some time, leaving a long and complex finish.
Feel - medium bodied, above average carbonation, and a strong brew at 8.2% ABV. Alcohol is very well masked, especially at low temperatures, making this beer very easy to drink.
Overall - a rock solid DIPA that is easy to drink, refreshing, and complex enough to be interesting.Sep 23, 2019', '4Really good beer, tasty. Nothing too special but it is nice never having to worry about enjoying a beer before opening it. I never have to worry about opening or buying a 2XIPA. Cheers.Aug 27, 2019', '4Pours almost clear light yellow with a thick white cap. Good retention and great lacing. Aroma is citrus and pine. Flavor is sweet up front, a touch of honey, a tad malty, some citrus and then bam here come the hops. Nice bitter finish. Feel is on the light side of medium bodied. Overall a nice beer once you get by the first sip which is a bit harsh.Aug 21, 2019', '4Decanted from a 12 oz (355 ml) can into a custom taster pint glass; canned on 06/26/19.
A: Pours a hazy, caramel amber color with a one finger, off-white head, cap retention, and soapy lacing.
S: Aromas of caramel, lemon, and pine.
T: Semisweet. Flavors definitely follow the nose, leaning more on the caramel. Solid bitterness balanced with flavors and sweetness. 
M: Medium bodied with excellent carbonation. A touch boozy, actually. 
O: A very drinkable and approachable, if strong, AIIPA.Jul 18, 2019', "412 ounce can, canned on 5/6/19. Thanks to my friend Denis for this! Served in a DFH Spiegelau IPA glass, the beer pours a mostly clear gold color with about an inch and a half off-white head that stuck around a while. There's also a lot of lacing. The brew smells like citrusy (grapefruit, lemon peel) hops, pine hops and bready malt. Taste is similar to the aroma, but there's also the addition of an earthy and a green apple flavor. I think it tastes hoppier than it smells, with the citrusy/grapefruit flavor being strongest to me. Mouthfeel/body is medium, it's a bit slick with a moderate amount of carbonation. I liked this, certainly worth a try if you've never had it before.Jul 18, 2019", "4.2512oz can into an IPA glass

Look: Pours a clear amber color with a big, off-white rocky head (Pretty good retention too.) Plenty of beautiful lacing on the way down that sticks to the glass.
Smell: Citrus and apple. Hops upon hops!
Taste: The hops dominate the palate, earthy and dry with some sweet malt on the finish. 
Feel: Medium bodied with a sticky, resiny finish.
Overall: My kind of DIPA. Resiny, dry and bitter. I didn't factor cost into the review but it's also super affordable, which is nice.Jun 14, 2019", "4L: A cloudy gold color. Almost a light tan. .5cm of head.
A: Crisp with striking hops. There is a faint smell of lemon and orange coming off of it.
T: Wow, hops hops and lots of hops. The hops are very heavy and easily the dominant flavor. Even the aftertaste is hops. Once the hop flavor starts to slide away a little, there are flavors of malt, caramel, and a breadiness. The bitterness hangs around for a good long while.
F: It is definitely astringent and bitter from the hops. You can definitely feel the astringency on your gums. The bitterness coats your mouth, but the other flavors do not.
O: It is an IPA, definitely an IPA and nobody will ever mistake it for anything else. I enjoy it, but I don't think I could drink more than one in a row... the bitterness can be overpowering. I think I'd like it more if additional flavors beyond just that of malt and caramel were expressed once the bitterness fades.May 25, 2019"]

['3Pours pale yellow with a 1" white head, which fades to a wisp. Minimal lacing. Hazy.

Aroma is floral, grass, bread.

Taste is light citrus, slight spiciness, wheat, yeasty.

Thin bodied, moderate carbonation. Dry finish.

Rather mild tasting wheat ale.Jul 10, 2021', "3Purchased as a single bottle from Kroger for $1.69. Poured into a hefe glass.

L - Hazy goldenrod with a three-finger sudsy, thick cream head.
S - Bubblegum and wheat. Spray-starch. Slight lemon peel.
T - Exactly the same as the smell.
F - Well-carbonated and sudsy. Clean finish. Wet. Very approachable.
O - An alright choice for a mid-day beer. The perfect beer to review as my 100th BA beer! I'll be honest - the flavor and scent profiles are simplistic even for the style, but the feel makes up for it all. It's nice and refreshing, and would honestly pair well with any sort of summer fare. It's an incredibly drinkable wheat ale, with plenty of inoffensive qualities. It's just that nothing really stands out, except for the beautiful three-finger head that lingers to the completion of the brew. This is going to sound a bit silly, but it's almost like drinking dishwater - but in a weirdly good way. I'd buy this again as a beer to offer house guests, but not so much for myself.Jun 26, 2021", '3.25Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a white cap that lingers, minimal spotty lacing. Aroma is mild, lemon. Flavor follows the nose. Feel is light bodied with adequate carbonation. Overall a decent beer without any real pluses.Jun 17, 2021', '3.5Picked this one up at the local liquor store because I remember going to Chicago Cubs games as a kid and seeing 312 being advertised and sold all over the place. I thought why not give this one a try on this beautiful Memorial Day here in Michigan. I will say the bottle on this one is beautiful. I am a guy who drinks straight out of the bottle and I will say this is one nice-looking bottle compared to your other generic wheat beers. This beer has a very wheaty smell and to me smells just like a "beefed-up" version of a typical American lager such as Miller or Coors. That smell goes right into the taste because this is a very wheaty/grainy tasting beer. While it is filling, this is a smooth beer that would go great with a day on the lake. A nice 6 pack of this stuff will serve you will an incredible day on a summer day.May 31, 2021', '3.25355 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 4.4%. Pale golden colour, hazy when the yeast is poured in, moderate white head. Spicy aroma, notes of cloves and coriander, hints of ripe bananas. Plenty of carbonation in the mouth. Refreshing flavour, spicy notes again, a touch of banana, but the beer is quite dry.May 08, 2021', '3.5Straight up good beer. It’s one of totally watch a game and drink, as it’s nice wheat profile is unobtrusive but pleasant. Nice golden color and decent foam head to it. Definitely have had better but it’s not the worst.Apr 05, 2021', '412 ounce bottle poured into a tulip glass.

L---Hazy, bright golden color. Nice white head with good retention and nice lacing. A good looking beer.

S---Strong wheat and grain with lemon backing those notes.

T---Wheat, grains, and then some honey and lemon. Tasty. 

F---Medium bodied, which is fairly heavy for the style and ABV. Well carbonated.

O---I guess I like this one a lot more than everyone else. This is a pretty good beer to me.Mar 04, 2021', '312 oz can, cool marketing. Hazy straw yellow color. lemongrass aroma with subdued wheat. Crisp taste that showed smooth fruit with hops near the end. Overall, non-eventful.Feb 23, 2021', '3.5Pours straw yellow, semi haze, 1cm head. Definitely smells like a wheat. Tastes like beer. Nothing stand out, nothing bad about it. Just straight up beer.Feb 12, 2021', "3.75Poured into a tall clear pint glass. Hazy, golden color in appearance. Decent retention and lacing.

Notes of wheat, lemongrass, citrus and citrus peels (particularly lemon), cloves, banana, coriander, and pepper.

Tastes like a standard wheat beer, but that's pretty much it. Has a nice lemon twang to it, and tastes refreshing. Body is medium-light.Feb 06, 2021", "3.25URBAN wheat. What does that even imply? The description states 'bright, lemony, a bit hazy' sounds like what I should expect out of any top-fermented wheat ale, so what makes this urban? 

First, my inspection of the pour results in a nearly barely unfiltered body with a solid bit of suspended yeast matter. The smell features notes of hop a forward ale - citrus notes - alongside mild wet wheat husk in the rounded portion. So the description checks out, but not so much in the taste. 

A large carbonated body in the first taste that is both bland and mildly spicy on the back end. At 18 IBU's and 4.2% ABV I know this is not an Earth-shattering take on the style, but I expect a bit of something when I have a sip rather than a pedestrian take on the American wheat style.

As mentioned, most of the flavors are a bit neutralized and the hoppiness in the backend appears to be the only noticeable thing standing out to me. Yeast strain seems a bit dull, and to be honest, this was not full-flavored; watery. Second tasting and again more hop flavor than wheat, very muted wheat notes in the malt it is as if they're hiding the wheat flavor behind other elements. Finishing off the pint I get a bit of the wheat notes in the back end, a mild sweetness you'd find in a german hefe yeast strain, but I am assuming this is from the hops. 

My lasting opinion is this is average, not bad warmed up, but not outstanding.Jan 30, 2021", '3.75Reliable refreshing beer with a lower ABV. Nice for a day long drinking session. Nice lemongrass taste and great mouthfeel. Hazy pour. Decent beer.Jan 27, 2021', '3.75Not sure why this beer gets so much hate (probably because it’s owned by AB) for what it is. I find 312 to be refreshing, sessionable, and crushable. What more of you need? 312 is not trying to break the newest boundary but to be a consistent and reliable option wherever you are in the US. 

Tastes of wheat, lemon, honey and grass. Has a slight haze to the body. Overall, the taste profile is balanced and keeps you coming back with just enough bitterness to balance things out. Again, this beer is not a world beater but it stands up to most macro options. Give me a 312 every day of the year over any Bud, Coors, or MillerNov 22, 2020', '2.5Taste quite a bit like a lemon/honey cough drop. For many this brings back memories of cold/flu. Perhaps some people will feel this taste is refreshing thoughNov 12, 2020', '3Cloudy, pale gold appearance with an average size head and little lacing. Subdued, wheaty, lemongrass aroma. Thin on the palate with a weak, wheatish, slightly fruity/citric taste. Light to medium bodied, decently carbonated mouthfeel with a short lived finish. Not a drainpour, but little to recommend.Oct 27, 2020', '3.25Appearance is a bubbly yellow, with a head that is minimal, and is gone in less than half a second. I mean gone, it just disappears. The smell is nearly not there at all. The taste is wheat and a little bit of citrus. The mouthfeel is better, with a good kick of carbonation. Overall, this is pretty much the definition of a mediocre beer.Jun 25, 2020', '3.75*Poured into a Teku glass from a 12oz bottle*

This poured a pale straw yellow, was clear, and had a good looking finger thick head. It had a good retention to it and left a lacing around my cup when the head dissipated.

The aroma on this was pretty sweet on the nose from the malted wheat, but there was also a noticeable amount of DMS present in the aroma. There was a lot of aromas of sweet corn and steamed vegetables. This wasn't particularly unpleasant smelling, but I wished the notes of the wheat weren't so muddied by the DMS.

The taste follows the nose for the most part, presenting notes of the malted wheat, DMS, but this time also had a decent amount of presence of citrus notes from the hops. In the end of the palate, I was able to pick up on more of the bread/biscuit character from the malted wheat which also had a slight grapefruit bitterness at the end.

This was a very drinkable/"crushable" beer. With very low bitterness and ABV, it also had a light body and a medium carbonation which contributed to its overall drink-ability and crispness.May 22, 2020', '3.5Decanted from a 12 oz (355 ml) bottle into a muffin top pint glass; best by 11 Sep 2020. 
A: Pours a hazy, yellow color with a one to two finger, white head, rim retention and very limited lacing. 
S: Aromas of cloves, unripened banana, coriander, and pepper. 
T: More semisweet than semidry. Palate follows the nose, but wheat character element. Very light bitterness creates balance. 
M: Light bodied with modest effervescence. A touch watery.
O: Drinkable and enjoyable. Not a standout, though. Would certainly do well on a hot beach day.May 09, 2020', "3.5I had this beer after the Chicago marathon in 2015. Like Immediately after crossing the finish line they gave me a plastic cup filled with this beer. I drank some of it, but couldn't drink the full thing. 

Wheat, coriander, clove, light citrus. Very simple and normally drinkable, but not after running a sub 3 marathon. I had more of this later on that day and it was a bit more enjoyable. Light, smooth, crisp, simple.May 08, 2020", '3.5This beer is an amber/orange color, cloudy, very effervescent, and has a white head that dissipates very quickly. The aroma is fruity and pleasant, but subtle. I notice a sweet grapefruit aroma. There is a earthy, yeasty, dry taste; typical of a wheat beer, but not much else in terms of flavor. Overall, I consider it a mediocre wheat beer.Feb 09, 2020', "3.75(I wrote this review on a flight I took in February, but kept forgetting to post it, it's only been edited for spelling)

Reading Bourbon County Stout and Selling Out made me want to try out this brew. Happened to be sold on a United flight I was taking. 

Pours creamy white head. The cup on the plane I tried this on was blue, so I cannot give an accurate description of the color. 

The nose is has some light spicy phenols, orange peel, crackers, white bread. Crackery retro-nasal. 

Taste is white bread, coriander, orange peel, lemon flesh without the acidity. Lightly sweet with a lightly dry and bitter finish. Twinge of alcohol in the finish as well. 

The mouthfeel is very smooth and a touch chewy. Body is just north of medium. The carbonation is quite high. Alcohol warmth is uncharacteristically high for a 4.2% beer. 

Overall, this is a full flavored, yet very drinkable beer. The only thing I feel is odd is how noticeable the alcohol is for the relatively small amount of alcohol in it.Dec 26, 2019", "3.5Clear golden, lively carbonation, big head dissapeared rather quickly.

Aroma was a bit muted. Some wheaty note and not much else.

Taste was a bit of a let down. Felt like a lager with a wheaty note.

Soft mouthfeel

Wouldn't buy again.Nov 22, 2019", '3.25Pours a golden colour, not unlike a lager. Smell reminds me of printing ink on paper - head still lingers into a respectable foam. Taste is a carbonated wheat, some grains but nothing special.Nov 02, 2019', '3.5Very drinkable, bright, and refreshing. Simple, light flavors of wheat, lemon, hint of banana, and hop flavor.

Not bad by any means, but not particularly interesting. Just balanced and drinkable.Sep 20, 2019', '3.5Taste: starts off nice and beery, finishes a bit tout 

Feel: if this was a stoner it would be Cheech. Nice and chill 

Again, who gives a fuck about look and smell.Sep 16, 2019']

['4Let me preface this with - I don’t like pale ales very often. While cruising down my very small town Walmart aisle, I saw this and took a chance. Good decision. Lovely, citrusy grapefruit and piney tastes, golden honey color, hoppy, sweet, almost sunshiney smell. Head was just wispy trails poured in a Pilsner glass. Nice sharp carbonation. Want also to point out that my label is different with a 420 Highway type sign being the prominent part of the label (small fish under Sweetwater logo) and and an ABV of 5.7%. I like this very much.Aug 28, 2021', '4SweetWater Extra Pale Ale poured into a SweetWater pint glass. A slightly hazy golden ale, very light carbonation, with a one inch pillow of pure white foam. The foam lasted several minutes leaving very thick lacing left behind.
The aroma is light malt and citrus hops, these are very noticeable.
The flavor is sweet, maybe honey, light citrus, mildly bitter, crisp finish. There is a light pine note at the finish also.
This is a bit thin feeling, making it very for a session type setting of liquid miles.
This is an easy drinker, very refreshing after spending the last few hours cutting wood in the heat. Thumbs up to my first SweetWater brew.Aug 16, 2021', '3.75A fantastic drinking pale ale. Just a lovely balance of malt and subtle hops. First dabbled with the 420 in Nashville and then again sometime last summer accompanied by a plate of meat. It was once again time to float down the SweetWater Stream this Fathers Day and there is no better friend to hangout with by the grill.Jun 21, 2021', "4Appearance: Pours a clear, golden color with a bubbling body, and strong and sticky white head. SRM of 9. (3.75)

Aroma: Mild to moderate aromas of some candied orange, sweet lemon, more tropical orange sweetness. A plastic pineapple fruit note too through the middle/end. A slight peach pith note. (4.00)

Flavor: Flavor follows with more pineapple, plastic lemon/orange citrus. Finishes with a yellow candy and pineapple lemon flavor to finish. A slight peach pith bitterness. Pale crackery malts to finish. (4.00)

Feel: Medium-bodied. Moderate carbonation. Feels juicy, but flavorful and smooth. (3.75)

Compared to Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale 6/2/21: Pours a lighter color. Stronger aromas. More candied orange, lemon, and pineapple. Less resinous orange, pine, soap, and caramel. More juicy and sweet.

Overall: Not really the west-coast pale ale I was expecting. Far juicier. It has some candied orange, yellow lemon and pineapple flavors. It does have a sweet lemon note that reminds me of the south. Compared to Sierra Nevada it is far juicier and hoppier. Drinks quite nice. Fruitier than I expected. (Final Rating: 3.96)Jun 03, 2021", "4.2516 oz can from the LCBO; listed at 5.7%, best before Jan 25 2022 and served barely chilled.

Pours clear and effervescent, its body golden yellow-hued and topped with nearly two fingers of puffy, foamy, sparkling white head. It recedes at a steady pace within the next several minutes, caking the glass with loads of sticky, messy, stringy lace in the process; the eventual remnants include a patchy cap and a generous collar of soapy suds. Looks great to me. The nose includes an enticing blend of floral, citrusy hops, joined by hints of wheaty grains and bread, as well as a touch of resiny, spicy hops.

This is a fine pale ale, displaying good balance between the malt and hop flavours - I'm getting wheaty bread and a touch of caramelized sweetness at first, with citrusy notes of orange and pink grapefruit cropping up not long after. It finishes moderately bittersweet, with suggestions of pine needles, spicy hops and light floral bitterness rounding out the tail end of the sip. Medium in body, with moderate carbonation levels that gently brush against the surface of the palate, giving a little bit of crispness to this pale ale's very smooth, slightly slick mouthfeel. Tasty and easy to pour down the hatch; at 5.7% I'd hesitate to call it a true session option, even though I could potentially see myself having a few cans in a row anyhow.

Final Grade: 3.97, a high B+. SweetWater's 420 Extra is one of the more old school American-style pale ales on the market, and now that I've tried it, it's not hard to see why it has been around for so long. It's hoppy, sure, but its Cascade and Centennial hop flavours are deftly balanced by its robust malt bill - and the end result is a highly drinkable ale that I will totally be picking up again in the future. If I had to choose between this and their IPA, I'd probably go with this one, but to be honest they're pretty close in terms of overall quality.May 29, 2021", '4Pours a nice clear gold colour, with a white fluffy head. Bitter and hoppy on the nose. The taste is crisp and clean, slightly bitter and hoppy in the right quotient.I detect hints of lemon as well. This is a nice APA. 
May 11 2021May 11, 2021', "3.5Good looking brew. Golden, slightly hazed. Moderate head, nice curtainy lace right to the bottom of the glass. Understated nose with a whiff of hops and some alcohol. Gently bitter front to back, decently crisp hops. In the end, a pretty quite beer, drinkable, unremarkable. A little aftetr 4:20 you won't care, so that makes it something of a safe bet.May 11, 2021", '3.75355 ml bottle, from the Norwegian importer. ABV is 5.7%. Slightly hazy pale golden colour, moderate white head. Pleasant aroma of citrus, tropical fruits and flowers, hints of honey. Slightly sweet flavour, citrus notes, hints of tropical fruits, decent bittering hops.May 05, 2021', "3.75473 ml can served cool into a pint glass. LCBO purchase for $3.25 CDN. Listed at 5.7% ABV.

Appearance - Clear dark golden color. Two plus fingers of white head rest on top and dissipate slowly.

Smell - Leafy hops, some light mango and pineapple notes. Healthy dose of grain backing things up.

Taste - Leafy hops again, a bit of pepper, general citrus flavor with mango being the most prominent. Medium bitterness.

Mouthfeel - Crisp, with lots of bubbles, medium bodied and spritzy, zesty finish.

Overall - Solid pale ale, not my favorite, but well made and enjoyable. Wouldn't turn it down if offered.May 05, 2021", '3.75I bought a can at the lcbo in Ontario 473ml at 5.7%.
best before date 25/01/22.
poured a 1to 2finger head into glass very slow carbonation. 
taste is tropical fruits and pine with medium bitterness. the beer leaves a lace as you drink it. 
overall a very easy drinking pale ale and enjoyable. to drink. 
cheersMay 03, 2021', '4Best by date : 8/22/21

Translucent orangey-gold, with slight white head . 

Smell is mostly light pine,dank green onion, with hint of something fruity.

Taste is vague citrus,pine, and floral hop flavors, with hint of crackery malt.

Feel is light-medium, with moderate, lightly-prickly carbonation.

Overall, nothing stands out , but it is pleasant and easy-drinking.Apr 29, 2021', "3.75I have some fond memories of Sweetwaters 420 Pale ale. Using a small tasting coupon inside the beer tent, engulfed by mid-summer heat within Centeroo at the Bonnaroo Music Festival. Sweetwater was somewhat elusive back in 2012. It wasn't until 2015 that I had the pleasure of retrying this in the mid-atlantic region. Today I saw it pop on the shelves because of yesterday's date, so it's time to revisit. 

The beer pours a very lovely caramel colour, hints of gold and amber mix to create a hue that is eye catching. A natural suspension of yeast floats throughout the ale, though fine in density. A retaining head that is slightly creamy sits on top agitated by the rising fine carbon dioxide stream throughout the body. A scent of juicy hop resins suggest this beer has been dry hopped in its finish. Deep within the smell are malt notes, but no real alcohol notes. 

Flavour profile is a classic west coast style pale ale, large ibu notes in the mid-30's(?) are a bit rounded by the malt-complexity of the beer. I do get a bit of a wheat note, but it is subtle and the hops really come through and whatever is used on the dry hopping is the most pronounced throughout the beer. At 5.7% ABV this is highly drinkable, very full bodied, with a medium mouth feel. The hopping, at least to me, doesn't create a overly bitter finish but you can tell you've consumed a pale ale. I am assuming this is the same house yeast strain used in their wheat blueberry beer Blue, as both the wheat notes and finish are similar in mouthfeel. 

Highly drinkable and would go well with BBQ, cheese plates, long talks, someone playing Wonderwall, or throwing bags drinking this out of a red solo cup.Apr 21, 2021", '3.75Pours a clear golden yellow with a white cap that lingers and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is mild, biscuits and hops. Flavor follows the nose but bolder. Feel is light bodied and well carbonated. Overall a nice pale ale.Apr 05, 2021', '5Great afternoon brew! Comparable to Rolling Rock pale ale, but much nicer. Perfect hopping, gentle pale malts. Time to get the BBQ cranking and the horseshoes flying!Apr 02, 2021', '4This is a pretty good pale ale. Right off the bat there is a surprising lack of hops, which i dont mind, just expected there to be a fair bit. This brew pours a lovely golden amber color with a thick lacy white head that hangs out for a minute before leaving. The smell is confusing to me, but there are citrus notes for sure, and maybe a lightly buttered cracker smell. Tastes very similar to the smell. The carbonation is light and it goes down smooth. Overall i would recommend this beer as a good all round anytime of day beer.Mar 31, 2021', '3.75L:. Pours a slightly cloudy golden orange with a small white head and some fingers of lacing on the glass.

S:. Fresh toasted malt, a slight tropical hop, some pine, but a slightly weak aroma for the style. Some toasted malt, the bitterness is the main factor here.

F:. Medium body, smoother carbonation.

O:. This one is pretty old school but still solid.

T:. Strong floral and piney hops, a medium to strong bitterness,Mar 20, 2021', '4.75Golden with chill haze, generous white head, nice retention and lace

Nice, light hop flavor, a bit of light malt underneath
Light bodied with good carbonation. 
A very drinkable and enjoyable beer.Jul 21, 2020', '3.5Clear light copper color, decent size white foamy head, light bready and citrus aromas, balanced malt and hop flavors. Light to medium body with a watery and somewhat thin mouthfeel, finishes with a mild bitterness, very average and middle of the road pale ale.Jun 01, 2020', '3.5Slightly hazed, bright gold appearance with a small white head and decent lacing. Herbal/floral hop aroma with soft grains in the background. Taste is a little sweeter and the hops a bit more citrusy than the expectations from the aroma.May 30, 2020', '3.25Pours from the can clean, translucent amber. Poor head retention. I liked it a lot but would like to try one with a bit more foam and maybe mouthfeel.May 30, 2020', '3.5Look: It pours golden with a white head. Head retention is good. 

Smell: It has some low toasted notes with low stone fruit. There is a low bit of dankness. 

Taste: It has some grainy sweetness with low toasty notes and a bit of floral in support. 

Feel: It has a medium body. 

Overall, it has some light flavors with a crisp finish.Apr 07, 2020', '4Taste of pine and citrus with some hop bitterness at the end. Look is a golden orange/yellow with a touch of haze. Definitely a solid session beer at 5.4%. This is one of my favorites from SweetWater. Overall it is a well made pale ale that I would like to have again.Mar 27, 2020', '2.75This IPA is god awful. I thought someone had just walked into the bar reeking of the worst weed I ever smelled. Little did I realize that my pint was put down in front of me at the same time. I she have nothing but scorn and I’ve summed it up already. A glass of skunk weed. The place I had it was sort of a dump so it could be how lines are cleaned or how old the keg was but until I try it again, this pan stands.Feb 25, 2020', '4Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.
Appears yellow, amber, nice head.
Smells slightly bready, floral, piney, citrusy.
Taste follows the nose, grapefruit and piney.
Mouth feel is medium for the style.
Overall a very nice ale that I would order again.Jan 27, 2020', '3.75Poured into a tall clear pint glass. Pours an amber-yellow with slight haze but mostly clear. Has a creamy white head about a finger-thick with decent retention and lacing.

Aroma consists of tropical hops, citrus, and bread malt backbone. Floral and herbal. Pineapple, mango, and citrus are the main notes in the aroma, while there are other notes of apricot, honey, caramel, biscuit, white grapes, and apples.

Taste somewhat follows the aroma, but there is a sort of mute bitterness to it. I can taste cereal malts well along with some pepper minty/peppery notes and grapefruit. But the rest of the notes in the aroma are in the background. Feel is medium-light.Nov 16, 2019']

['4.2512oz bottle. Clear, pale amber colour with a rapidly collapsing, off-white head. Caramelised orange aroma. Clean, not heavy, flavours of marmalade and resin. Medium body with a full mouth coating and a bitter finish. Classic AIPA. A stack load of hops nicely balanced by a solid malt base. A 20yo classic.Aug 28, 2021', '3.5It’s an IPA. Slight haze descent head and nice small bubbles. More crisp than malty. Flavor of the hops add pine notes and a grapefruit citrus. Easy drinking and down the middle for the type.Aug 23, 2021', '4Needed a crisp, lighter break from my usual NE Impetial IPAs.

Also better chilled than the 90-minute, which is my sipping dessert choice.Aug 01, 2021', '3.75I wanted to dislike this so I could say something along the lines of "60 Minute IPA? It took me as long to get through it". But it's actually fine. Now I have to write a new joke before the end of this review. 

It pours clear gold with a lingering white head. Not much hop character on the nose. Instead, it smells rather sweet and malty with a hint of orange. When I first tasted it, I wasn't enthused. Over time, I warmed up to it. The hops are mostly dank and citrusy, but not overpowering. Some malt, caramel and biscuit, is able to poke its head out. It finishes bitter. You will definitely be tasting it into your next drink. Man, is it smooth! Even if you aren't a hop-head, you have to admit it's very easy-drinking. Carbonation is pretty-

Oh, I've got one! 60 minutes could save you 6% or more on ABV.Jul 18, 2021', '4Pours a clear golden color with a thick cap of white head. 
Caramel aroma with citrus peel and pine. 
Slightly sweet caramel malt with orange peel and grapefruit. Finished with a pine bitterness. Very well balanced and smooth. 
This is a delicious beer that has stood the test of time.Jul 14, 2021', '3.25L: Pours a clear gold. White head with some retention. Nice lacing. 

S: Not picking up much. 

T: Much stronger than the nose. Bitter with a dry finish. Lingering bitterness. 

F: Medium bodied; medium carbonation. 

O: I’m surprised at the high rating. I’m pretty disappointed by this. May have gotten an old bottle.Jun 20, 2021', '4.5Perfect balance of hop flavor and bitterness with a strong malt backbone. Still holds up after all these years. This is always consistent when fresh, and anyone giving this below a 4 is either drinking an older bottle, or they are a beer elitist. This is famous for a reason.May 05, 2021', "4Solid. Not quite as appealing aroma or appearance wise as Two Hearted Ale. Not offensive in any way. Very nice feel. It's a mellow beer with enough flavor to keep you sipping. 6% ABV so one after work is perfect to stretch the life of a sixer throughout the week. Seems like everybody knows and loves it, so if you offer one to someone they won't look at you like you have lobsters crawling out of your ears. Looking forward to finding 90 and 120 minute IPAs for upcoming events. Drink it!Apr 29, 2021", "3.75This seems to be a maltier IPA with less of the floral sweet and citrusy hops. A good contrast to the many others this summer. Near the end it's almost bock like.Apr 28, 2021", '4To me, an old favorite, one of the first IPAs I tried, maybe 20 years ago (?) While it has been surpassed in my esteem my many others since then (including Dogfish 90) I still welcome the opportunity to drink a few. Kind of thin, kind of hoppy for my taste, but fun and refreshing.Apr 21, 2021', '3.75Pours a yellow gold in color, similar to apple juice, with a bitchin two-finger off-white head that dissipates fairly quick. Smells resiny & piney upfront, not really smelling any malts for balance. Taste is much better, great quality hops, with the nice balance of malts to go with the bitterness of the beer. Medium-bodied, moderate carbonation, crisp, refreshing, clean, very drinkable.Mar 12, 2021', '4This is a beautiful beer- great color, thick head, incessant carbonation, satisfying lacing. For me, the rest is perfectly drinkable but a bit disappointing. Some dank odors with a deep sniff. Good mouth feel and finish, but the part that hits the tongue is mildly bitter without much else.
Update from later in the six pack (over a few days)- the gentle taste has grown on me. This is a really sublime and good beer.Mar 07, 2021', '4.25L: Slightly hazy amber color, two finger white head, nice lacing, light carbonation.

S: Hoppy.

T: Hoppy, malty, smooth, slightly bitter.

F: Medium bodied, nicely flavored, extremely drinkable.

O: Very good IPA.Feb 15, 2021', '3.75The beer is a dark straw with a finger of white head. The head gives way to a lace. The beer is very clear and transparent. The nose has a base of sweet malt. The malt is like a heavy bread. Hop wise there, the smell is piney and citrusy. Specifically the citrus character comes out as grapefruit and is overshadowed by the pine. On tasting, the malt and pine notes are strong at first. The hops become earthy and then spicy as the malt fades. At the end of the palate the malt comes back and blends smoothly the spicy and earthy hops. The aftertaste is bitter as expected. The mouthfeel is loose with somewhat soft water. It washes over your mouth well. The carbonation i strong and pleasant.Feb 14, 2021', "4.25Thought it was about time someone reviewed this beer....oh, wait a minute; some have. Well, maybe I can offer something original....no, looks like all those bases are covered. Let's just say totally refreshing, widely available and reasonably priced. Maybe review the 90min next. Surely no ones been there yet.Feb 10, 2021", '4.25Pours a hazy light amber thanks to a less than careful pour that got some lees. Punch grapefruit orange citrus and floral hops with a nice rich, biscuity malt base. Hint of pine, dankness. Flavor is similarly balanced between the two. Nicely bittered. Nice full mouthfeel.Jan 23, 2021', "4.2512oz bottle. Stamped on bottle neck is best by date of 'Mar 2021'.
Clear, deep gold colored body. One finger of white head sticks around. Some jagged lines of lacing stick on glass.
Aroma of bready malt base with citrus and floral hops. Not very aromatic.
Taste is old school East Coast IPA, with low bitterness. Malt base, and floral, grassy, and citrus hops.
Medium mouth feel. Some hop numbness on the tongue. Very good carbonation. Fizzes well in the mouth.
Classic style and taste. Clearly hop driven but low in bitterness. Very drinkable. When I first drank this years ago, the excessive bitterness in IPAs was going on, and my impression was that this beer was lacking. With more experience I now recognize this as just a well made IPA, one to come back to again and again.Jan 15, 2021", '4.25Drank from a 19oz can. Pours dark golden yellow (brown?) with a thick and lasting white foamy head. Nice hop / malt balance with notes of caramel and bread (I think... still finding my palate). Old school craft. Really good.Jan 07, 2021', "412 oz. bottle with a freshness date of May 2021: Poured a bright and clear golden hue with a sustained, foamy white-head. I was surprised to find this one so fresh and at only $6.99 a six-pack.

An explosion of refreshing, tropical fruit greeted the olfactory upon opening the bottle.

It has been quite a while since I imbibed a basic straight-forward IPA, i.e, one that is not hazy, fruity, and a double, triple or imperial IPA. As this is from a brewery that made its name with experimental beers, this is quite impressive. Very strong flavors of mango, and orange, and mild grapefruit keep this one refreshing, while the hop profile is never bitter. For 6 percent ABV, this is dangerously quaffable. 

It is has been years since I drank this one; I'll have to remember this is quite an impressive interpretation of an American IPA, especially at that price.Jan 02, 2021", '4.75C: Clear, golden, nice head retention with big bubbles that come to a cap pretty quickly, nice cascading, almost no carbonation through the beer

S: Hoppy IPA smell, greeny grassy smell with touch of lemon fruity esters

T: Light hoppy, grassy, lemony, malty (bready biscuit) finish. Very good and much hoppier than the 90 min that I am used too. Not boozy at all, not very yeasty, but there is definitely a malty bready finish

F: Light, not effervescent, not pungent, not mouth coating, not oily yet not creamy, very smooth and very drinkable

Overall: wonderful hoppy flavor, affordable, fresh (10/21/2020) not much to dislike about this American IPA, it represents its style very well I give it a 95Dec 28, 2020', '3.75Poured a honey gold from a bottle with a thin white head and minimal lacing. Nose of grapefruit and honey is very faint. Taste of grass, honey malt and citrus. Piney hops is pronounced and lingers on the finish. Moderate body and carbonation. Fairly drinkable but no wowie zowie here.Dec 05, 2020', "3.5On draught. Good 3 finger head, caramel color. Smell is piney hops, sweet malt. Taste follows and is nicely balanced. Great lacing. Quite frankly, there is nothing worse than an overhopped beer with no supporting malt base. I think most followers of ipa's are very new to beer and just like to follow trends. This is one of the better ipa's ive had and its solely because of the balance of malt and hop. Would recommend.Dec 01, 2020", "3.75Overall decent West coast IPA. Not sure what it is but it doesn't spark my interest. I think it's just too middle of the road. Also, its a bit more sour than bitter which put me off. The mouth feel is great though, it's 
soo smooth for an IPA.Nov 15, 2020", '3.75Umm, sure. Why not? This one is a classic, and I believe that I’ll treat it like such. Yeah, it’s pretty much AOL on a dial up; it will do the trick at the time, but there was a more beautiful and bright future to be had. A lil caramel, a lil malt... Yeah, that’s basically it. So ima peace out.

Bye!Nov 07, 2020', "3.5Poured into tulip unmarked.
L: an orangey yellow, deeper than straw. dirtier but transparent. a solid white foam of about two inches forms. slight haze.

S: grass and grapefruit. Sweaty socks on the end, but like hardwork paid off. Slight juice but balanced by malt

T: Barnyard citrus, Fruit hidden by farm or pigsty, in the best of ways. I notice a lot of grass clippings. Oak on the finish. Flavors are pronounced but could work better together. Stone fruit here and there.

F: Bitter throughout, liquid gelatin. Short lived effervescence that remains on the palate subtly for a time.

Overall, this IPA feels the best out of any I have tried. It doesn't flop and does what a direct IPA should. Juiciy yet bitter. Dank and fruity- a great balance.Oct 30, 2020"]

['4Reminded of this beer by the How many Beers of Fame have you reviewed? post. Reviewed from memory, have probably had about a six-pack in my life. This is fine, but does not live up to the hype.Mar 20, 2021', '4Clear, bright amber coloring, beautiful bone white head, lasting long, looking lovely.

Aroma: Ah! Citrus and pine aplenty. Gorgeous. A little tropical fruit, melon and pineapple in this nose. Orange and lime, too. Ah, I say again.

Taste: Boom! Just what we want from an IPA, but creamy and smooth and just delightful. Bittersweet notes blast the palate, followed by malty sweetness. None too caustic, this IPA, it's smooth and palatable as can be.

I peeked at the label. Maple syrup? Not getting that yet. Huh.

Hop bitterness is restrained, but enjoyable. Delicious. Tasty. I'm loving it. I'm liking this so much, it's time to find out more about it. Okay, so…."A bottle conditioned India Pale Ale with maple syrup." 7.5% ABV. There are some situations when 90 is too much. There are other situations when 60 is too little. There are many situations when 75 is just right. Bottle-conditioned with pure maple syrup for complexity and dry-hopped out the bejeezum boards."Oct 17, 2020', "4.2512oz bottle. Unfortunately I did not check the bottling date, which is '10/29/19', which makes the beer about eleven months in the bottle. I picked this up out of the store's cooler, and didn't think I needed to date check. Anyways . . . 
Cloudy, deep gold colored body. One finger of lingering white, pillowy head. Not much left on the glass for lacing.
Aroma is grassy and muddy hops, with a sweet note from the maple syrup. Solid malt background.
Taste is grassy and piney hops, with a sweet note. Approaching a bitter note but not quite. Smooth trail off into the after taste. Allowing the beer to sit on the tongue really brings out the maple and hop combination.
Mouth feel is the best attribute of the beer, with dense coating and filling of the mouth. Very good carbonation.
I will try to try this again with a younger bottling date, but this is still a very good hoppy, but sweet, concoction.Sep 23, 2020", '4I got a bottle of this beer off the single shelf at a beer store in LaCrosse, WI whilst there to move my daughter into school. The beer poured a clear golden with thin white head that is leaving a nice lace. The scent was mild hop notes. The taste was nicely balanced and easy to drink with smooth citrus hop presence and a tangerine finish. The mouthfeel is medium in body with good carbonation. Overall it is a good beer.Sep 07, 2020', '41/11/20...pours medium copper with a light ring of white foam. Oaky nose, hints of sour. Woody. Flavors if grape, oak, and maple sweetness. Heavy bitter checked in the background. Overall a balanced sweet maltiness w/ an oaky bitter. Interesting and quite good.Mar 28, 2020', '4.75Decanted from a 12 oz (355 ml) into a Captain Lawrence muffin top pint; bottled 10/4/19.
A: Pours a hazy, orange amber color with ochre highlights, a one to two finger, orange meringue colored head, full finger retention, and foamy, sticky, and persistent lacing.
S: Aromas of caramel, pink grapefruit to orange, and pine in glorious balance.
T: Sweet. Flavors follow the nose, but seems complex in its simplicity. Solid, but not overpowering, i.e balanced bitterness.
M: Medium bodied with very robust carbonation. Smooth and easy drinking.
O: I thought it was remarkable similar to the 90 minutes, which means in was just delicious. Incredibly well concocted and executed beer.Mar 27, 2020', '2.75Poured from a bottle into a shaker pint. Purchased at Trader Joe’s. 

Look: Transparent with some light chill haze. Thick white head. Color is a light caramel. 

Smell: Very malt forward with a bitter floral hop bit. Like whole wheat bread. Some toffee notes. No maple to be found. 

Taste: Big and malty up front. Then a huge citric and floral hop bite comes in to the body with that distinct dogfish head IPA yeast. I’m not getting any maple here either. 

Feel: Too big for 7.5%. High bitterness and sweetness that do not cancel each other out. Good carbonation.

Overall: The maple isn’t there and the IPA is not good enough on its own. I feel like if the maple rich sweetness was there it would help but instead the whole equation gets thrown off with that one missing part. Just okay.Feb 16, 2020', '4.25Dogfish Head Craft Brewery "75 Minute IPA"
12 fl. oz. brown glass bottle, "BOTTLED ON 10/04/19 1347" and sampled on 01/25/20
$2.99 @ Total Wine & More, Cherry Hill, NJ

Notes via stream of consciousness: It's poured a hazy golden-orange body beneath a full head of off-white foam. The head retention appears to be pretty good. The aroma is grainy/malty with just a touch of maple syrup, and citrusy, piney, and floral with what I'm guessing are Cascades and/or some other "C hops". Hehe, I just looked at the label and it reads "off-centered art series FEATURING DAN STILES" - he's a friend of mine. Moving on, the flavor is fuller than the aroma might lead you to believe but it's pretty much the same. It's grainy, bready, and a little honeyish and sweet on the front of the tongue, but the hops and maple syrup immediately step in and transform it. The hops are gently citrusy, leafy, herbal, piney, and spicy. The leafy and herbal qualities enhance the malt & maple syrup while the citrus, pine, and spice lend it contrast and an additional balance beyond the bitterness that's there. It's medium-full in the mouth with a delicate bristle of carbonation before warming to become smooth and creamy. It's an interesting beer. It's pretty big (how strong is it? 7.5%) and a bit sweet but it's completely balanced. It transitions from malty to malty & hoppy, and then finishes drier but not too bitter with just a spritz of alcohol helping out the hops. I drank that REAL quick and I certainly didn't intend to. I've got just a swig and small sip left. The only thing that's let me down ever so slightly is that the lacing wasn't better. It still scores a 4.25 out of 5 though!
Review #6,921Jan 25, 2020', '3Disappointing ipa from one of the best breweries in the USA. Smells and looks great, but tastes smoky and harsh. It does have an interesting aftertaste, but not exceptional.Jan 20, 2020', '4Dogfish Head 75 Minute IPA, 7.5% ABV. Pours orange with a 2-finger off-white head that left heavy foam lacing. Nose is malt, flowers, sweet maple and melon. Taste is malt, maple, light citrus, moderate to heavy bitterness. Excellent mouthfeel, overall excellent.Jan 12, 2020', '4L:. Pours a Amber red with a small white head and thick lacing around the glass 

S:. Cracker malt, grass, and floral notes, notes of maple and sweetness.

T:. Cracker malt, floral and nutty hops, notes of sweet maple.

F:. Smooth velvety mouthfeel, bigger body.

O:. This is a interesting different IPA.Jan 01, 2020', '4.2512oz bottle into a tulip.

L: Very lightly hazy (by today's IPA standards, at least) orange-amber body under a 3/4" head of off-white foam. Good retention and thick lace. Quite nice indeed.

S: Piney, resinous hops are front and center. Caramel-drizzled grapefruit pith as it warms. Simple, direct, and enticing.

T: Balance of sweet malt and bitter hops up front, with candied citrus being the dominant flavor. Maybe a hint of maple, but I doubt I'd have recognized it if it weren't listed on the label. Solid resinous bitterness on the finish - crazy bitter by today's standards, but it works well. Really tasty old-school IPA.

F: Soft, well-carbonated medium body. Excellent.

O: Thoroughly enjoyable beer. Better than either 60 or 90 for my palate, although the latter will always have a dear place in my heart as a gateway to hops over a decade ago.

Beers of Fame tick 182/250. Cheers!Dec 24, 2019', '3.25Hazy and anticipated it to be sweeter. Maple wasn’t as prominent. Easy to drink, but bitter. I’m big on aftertaste and this wasn’t too bad. Some bite.Dec 23, 2019', "4From a 12oz bottle dated 9/26/19 into a pint glass. Color is a murky yellowish brown, not quite opaque, with about a half finger of white head, moderate retention and lacing. Smell is a little weak. Picked up some hop bitterness on opening the bottle with some sweetness coming from the glass after the pour. Taste: This is pretty close to 90 Minute IMO with some sugary sweetness. Not totally picking up maple syrup, but the taste isn't a negative either. Pretty sharp hop bitterness on the swallow and aftertaste. Bitterness is a little strong on the mouthfeel. I would choose 90 minute over this but overall a decent brew that I would revisit.Dec 14, 2019", "3.75Bottled 9/26/19

Pours a hazy amber with a small white head with some nice lacing

A mild hop aroma meets the nose, not unlike the 90 minute, it's just toned down. The maple comes through less than I had hoped

The taste brings the maple forward a bit in the finish, a nice sugary vibe. Otherwise it's a pretty standard, well balanced IPA

Medium in feel with fairly good carbonation, a soft and dry finish

I wish I had found this a bit sooner so it would've been fresher, but still not badDec 11, 2019", "4I like the bottle label artwork, great use of color. The pour is marmalade color. The taste is malts, grapefruit, pine, & orange. The beer can use some more of the maple syrup because it's too subdued. Cheers! BDec 06, 2019", '4.25Six pack copped from Kings in Morristown. Pours a golden, bronze hue with moderate frothing. Assertive aroma replete with hints of citrus and grapefruit. Similar overall flavor profile. Recommended.Nov 25, 2019', "3.75A decent IPA. Nothing special. Poured from 12 oz. bottle, typical light head, decent lacing. I don't taste any maple syrup. The mouthfeel is epecially nice and thick though. Nice creamy texture to it. Still...probably won't buy it again. Go with the outstanding 90 min, or 120 min IPA's. Much better beers.Nov 20, 2019", '3.75Bottle from Brewers Haven. Medium amber with thin creamy head. Aroma: oranges, caramel, fruity notes. Taste follows with some orange zest, sweet caramel, toffee, apples . Falls a bit flat at the finish, but finishes clean.Nov 05, 2019', "4Pours out mildly hazy gold color. Like amber or sap. A finger of head with some nice lacing. 

Smell is a mixture of pine, citrus, some pineapple, a bit of sweetness, and malt. All very mild and complimentary with each other. 

Taste is light pine bitterness first. Immediately followed up by caramel malt notes that transition into a more crackery malt profile. Not getting much maple syrup, but it is there. This is a touch sweeter than your average IPA which rounds it out nicely. 

Mouthfeel is smooth. Nice density, almost sticky. Lively carbonation, but smooth bubbles. Creating a nice balance. Bite comes only briefly and disappears, making you want to sip more.

This is a nice approachable IPA for anybody who might be hesitant to try this style of beer. Relatively light, refreshing, smooth, and nicely balanced. It isn't mindblowing, but it simply doesn't have to be. It achieves a respectable level of enjoyment.Oct 26, 2019", '4.25I was lucky enough to find one of these in the back of a mixed cooler. A darker pour. Smells very hoppy. A very bright hoppy flavor with a sweet subtle maple finish. Incredibly smooth for an ipa. How could an ipa brewed with maple syrup be any good? I have no idea but it is exceptional.Apr 13, 2019', '4Pours a hazy orange gold with a one finger white frothy head. A thin film of head remains throughout. Moderate lacing. Mild aroma of herbs and citrusy hops. Taste is malt forward with a hint of maple syrup followed by grassy and citrus hops with a piney finish. Well balanced. Soft buttery mouthfeel. Moderate - light carbonation.Mar 03, 2019', '4Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip...

Pours a fine looking amber/gold with plenty of haze. An initial two-finger foamy head gives way to a nice collar of lacing. An excellent appearance.

The aromas are somewhat subdued, but pleasant. Solid malt sweetness up front, but with good balance. Grassy, earthy, and citrusy hops arrive as well, with a hint of barrel and booze.

The flavor is definitely skewed a bit sweet, but not necessarily from the maple. The malts are solid and biscuity., with some graham cracker notes noticeable. There is a bit of a soapy/tingly aftertaste that distracts from the primary hop notes, which are solid but nothing remarkable. Typical grapefruit, pineapple, and resin hop flavors arrive with a touch of booze at the finish.

The mouthfeel is decent, if a bit flat on the carbonation side. Medium bodied, it isn't sticky, but isn't crisp either. It is, in fact, rather "moderate" in every aspect. 

Overall, a solid IPA that, nevertheless, doesn't measure up to either of the brews ostensibly blended to arrive at this one.Mar 03, 2019', "3.5EP 1:
The inclusion of maple syrup into the brewing process makes this IPA have an interesting and defining buttery mouthfeel and flavor, setting it apart from most other brews in the style. Not something to get every day, but certainly worthwhile if you're looking for something new and challenging.

EP 16: 
The sweet and rich flavor that the maple syrup adds to this beer is a welcome paring with the underlying IPA makeup. This is certainly not a go-beer for us, but we all enjoy it occasionally as a nice spinoff. Essentially, we agree with our previous rating. Go us.Feb 16, 2019", "3.75Poured into a weizen glass from a refrigerated bottle.

Look: A dark orange, amber, hazy in color with a decent head. Llooks like an amber with an orange hue.
Smell: The hop aroma is strong and heavy. I can smell the heaviness of the this beer.
Taste: Not overly sweet. I suppose maple syrup could be appreciated, but I don't notice much. Lacks any fruity/citrus presence.
Body: A heavy body but minimal carbonation. Slightly oily.

Overall: An interesting IPA. The smell is the best aspect of the beer. Its a heavy bodied IPA with minimal bitterness or fruit character. I personally could not appreciate the syrup taste, but its definite in the mouthfeel.Feb 04, 2019"]

['4.5I am not a lover of all things IPS. This one is unusually GOOD. Very hoppy- but does not have the overwhelming grapefruit juice flavor of many popular IPAs. Very strong malt flavors combne with the very nice (NOT all grapefruity) hop flavors. I was afraid to try it, but am glad I did. I'd love to compare it against Middle Ages "Late Knight IPA, which is a similar style that I can enjoyToday at 04:09 AM', '4.5Descent head that disappears. Dark golden almost copper color. Lots of tiny bubbles that add effervescence and freshness to rich mouth feel. An IPA imperial that is both very malty and hoppy at the same time. For a heavily hopped beer there is lots of flavor but not unpleasantly bitter as many an IPA can be. Wonderful stuff, 9% strong without tasting boozy.Aug 17, 2021', "4.25I've tried my fair share of IPAs and this stomps all of them. It isn't trying to mask any flavors with bitterness, instead going for a malty but only slightly hoppy tone. Great taste, or should I say, I can actually taste it without getting assaulted by hops. And quite an easy drinker for 9%. Would recommend picking it up if you find it.Aug 07, 2021", "4.75Everywhere I go, I order this and whatever beer I'm in the mood for. The reason is that whomever I'm with ... I want them to sample a pour of 90 Minute IPA; proof that a 9% ABV doesn't have to be bitter. Always magnificent!Jul 31, 2021", '4.25Look is a coppery fairly clear color
A nice foamy head that slowly subsides 
The aroma is definitely malty
First taste is malt and alcohol, in a good way!
The hops are there, but I think nicely combined with the malt and a bit of dankness. 
Lovely mouthfeel. 
Overall a VERY nice imperial IPAJul 15, 2021', "4.5A clear amber beer. A slight issue with too much head when pouring. A strong but smooth IPA - I can't think of another beer with this much alcohol & hops that is still smooth.Jul 11, 2021", "4.25After binging for years on ipa's. A break was in order. Too much hops to much alcohol is par for the course.
However, when I do go ipa I have a good backlog of ideas and tastings.
Haven't had this one in ten pluses years. One of the first double ipa's I ever tasted!
So, when the local gas station surprisingly had this it brought memories of yesteryear.
I was not disappointed! Outstanding on all levels. And now with a different palate I only drink malted forward ipa's. But this has has all the bouquet of the hop bombs without the excessive bitterness!
CheersJul 04, 2021", '4.5Wow this is serious. So happy to finally have tried this. It’s hoppy as all get out but very drinkable. It hits you with wheat goodness and has got some sweeter notes without being too much.Jun 27, 2021', "4.5Poured from a 12-oz bottle into pint glass in June 2021. There was no brewed date on the label. I drank this less about 1 month after purchase.

Appearance: Deep gold color with huge white head. It is a bright and has a clear color, like other IPAs. Head is very thick, and it lasts a minute time, leaving a small covering. There is a lot of lacing on the glass.

Smell: The aroma filled the room while the beer was being poured. Strong aroma of citrus, pine, and hops, as well as some sweetness like pineapple. Also, a little earthy or straw aroma. Overall, the citrus aroma dominates the other aromas.

Taste: Sweet taste with a strong bitter hops edge. There is also a nice malt sweetness as well. This matches the 'powerful malt backbone' statement on the label. There is a typical hops and citrus flavor, but with some sweetness as well. This is bitter like most other IPAs. Has a very nice after-taste that lasts a long time. Overall a nice balance and very drinkable.

Mouthfeel: Medium-Strong bodied, which makes this very drinkable. Medium-Strong alcohol, which matches the 9.0% listed.

This is a very good and interesting IPA. It has a nice mix of citrus, grapefruit, hops, malt, and other flavors, which makes it enjoyable. I like the overall balance, and that the citrus flavors are pronounced but do not dominate the flavor. It has more of a hop edge than many other IPAs. This would be a good IPA to drink often. 

This is one of my favorite IPAs, and I will definitely buy this again.Jun 26, 2021", '4.75nose is very piney and hoppy, some sweetness.
taste is very bitter and hoppy at first, tongue hurts a bit. fruitiness in body. notice more of a sweetness in smell after tasting. finish and after taste seems a bit dry and sticky. Opens up as it warms and seems more boozy. Some malt / grain taste in after taste.

appearance is clear, amber, nice lacing.
a classic.May 13, 2021', "4.25It smells so fresh.\xa0 There is sweetness and a citrussy fruit scent.\xa0 It almost smells like a hoppy pear.

The sweetness is still there when I taste it but more prominent is the complexity of both citrus and dank hops and bitterness.

It's light and refreshing. It feels smooth, sudsy and easy to drink. The aftertaste is long lasting and politely bitter.

Overall it's a really good IPA. I love how every brewery's IPAs have their own distinctive taste and this one has it's.\xa0 Delicious really. I give it a 5.1 out of 6.May 10, 2021", '4.5Deep, glowing orange color and lightly translucent. Very even head that remains for some time and leaves good lacing. Smell is floral and sweet, with hints of orange and mango. The taste, oh the taste. The body is heavily floral, with hints of cherry, orange, and vanilla. The hops come out on the finish, slightly dank, but the bitterness is surprising low for an imperial. The feel is creamy, and you’re left with a rich coating on your tongue, which I assume comes from the high ABV. 
This is my new favorite IPA. It’s as rich in its own right as most barrel aged stouts, and balances sweet and bitter amazingly. Sip it, savor it, make it last 90 minutes if you can.May 05, 2021', '3.5I feel like I got a wicked old one as I tasted no hops, just bitter or alcohol and the head was like 3 inches. Definitely giving another shot at another time so I can scrap this review.May 05, 2021', "3.5Before I start, I'm not the biggest imperial ipa fan. This is also my first review, so I'm not much of an expert with these. With that being said...

Look: Dark amber color.
Smell: Malty with slight hop aroma.
Taste: Overall not too hoppy, wish I could taste the hops a bit more but it's pretty malty.
Feel: Thicker with a drier finish.
Overall: Can see why other people would like it because it is one of the better imperials I've had. I'm just not the biggest fan of imperials.Apr 24, 2021", "4Poured from 12 oz bottle into a 16 oz pint glass. Bottle says best by August 2021 so I imagine this beer is about halfway through it's shelf life. 


This is the first imperial IPA I ever had but I never got around to reviewing it. All I remember from years ago is it went down like beer punch. Let's dive into a proper review of this classic.

The appearance is a dark reddish-amber with a 1inch head that clings to the sides of the glass. Right off the bat I get a whiff of ruddy caramel malts, some candy aroma. The hop aroma is more herbal than piney. Some citrus aroma, and hints of blueberry. The taste is on the malt side, the hops really don't jump out off this one. Rasberry black tea like flavor. Pie crust. Refreshing flavor, just slightly chewy. Lingering malt finish. The alcohol is well concealed. This is such an easy drinking beer. I always referred to it as a classic east coast IPA (before the whole hazy New England IPA thing). It doesn't have the bitter hop astringency or tropical flavors of for example a Lagunitas or Green Flash west coast IPA. Rather this beer is bordering on being a light barleywine. Darken it just a tad more and up the abv and it woud be into barleywine territory.

Overall, not quite as good as I remember, but still very good. A unique alternative to the face melting bitterness of a lot of the IPA's I am used to drinking.Apr 08, 2021", '3.75Sampled bottle, RBNAG 2007 in Grimstad. Dark amber colour. Nice hoppy aroma, not as strong as expected. Very hoppy flavour throughout, bordering on "too much". Plenty of taste, you might say ...Mar 19, 2021', '4.5I’m knew to reviewing beers so I’m practicing. I’ve read through how to review and how to taste... so hear it goes:

Look: 4
Amber

Smell: 3.5
Floral at first pour, Malty

Taste: 4.5
Wow this is really balance and delicious 

Mouth: 4.5
Medium body, Smooth, Light carbonation, bitter at the end

Overall = 4.5

This was a really good, and balanced IPA... really liked the malty ness 

How do others discern between 4, 4.25, 4.5?Mar 07, 2021', "4.512oz bottle. Stamped on bottle neck is best by of 'Aug 2021'. Revised, updated label.
Clear, deep gold colored body. One finger white head. Fragmented sheets of lacing.
Aroma is citrus and pine hops with a malt backbone.
Taste is sweet caramel malt, with a hop punch that is dank, piney, with a bit of citrus. Aftertaste is a sweet caramel and pine candy bar. 
Fuller mouth feel, and an invitation to swirl the beer in the mouth. Very good carbonation. Has a bit of a dry finish due to the alcohol percentage.
Excellent balance of sweet and bite. Allows the higher ABV% to express, but not to burn. Old school goodness.Feb 24, 2021", '4I have had this beer on draft many times but never reviewed it. Now here I sit with a 12 oz bottle to try.

Pours a clear brownish orange with a small short lived head.

Smells of malt, slightly dank hops and alcohol. Tastes of sweet caramelly malt with a mildly bitter hop and warm boozy finish.

Medium heavy body with light carbonation. Lightly syrupy mouthfeel.

This is a well made old school IPA .Jan 19, 2021', '4.5Overall, a superbly crafted double IPA that balances the hoppiness with strong malt/syrupy sweetness. Very heavy, as in you can’t have more than one! Unlike Stone Enjoy By series or like Russian River Mind Circus IPA! But I still give it two thumbs up.Dec 29, 2020', "3.75This is Dogfish Head's 90 Minute IPA. The bottle is a little old, so the flavor might be off a bit. It has a crisp nose of hops, but not overpowering. The color looks like a typical pale ale. The malt tries to get in there, but the hops quickly usurp the flavor. It's not a citrus flavor like cascade, but a pleasant bitterness nonetheless. The malt shows up on the back end as it leaves, and the mouthfeel is surprisingly clean. I expected a sticky feeling.Nov 19, 2020", "4.5A pint of golden bronze came from a tap head, replete with a solid and a lasting white topping. The head and glass lacing endured a slow and savory finish of the beer. This ale has everything it should and nothing it shouldn't. There're sweet malts, body, hoppy bitterness and softness to the palate, all in perfect unison. Consistent from first taste to the last drop, this is remarkabley excellent.Sep 25, 2020", '4.5Slightly dark amber color with a decent head. Hoppy, piney, citrus aromas. Bold taste that is citrusy, but not too hoppy or bitter. Medium body finish that lingers but still not too bitter. My favorite of all the Dogfish brews.Sep 19, 2020', "4.5Botted 07/01/20. At 75 days, probably the freshest I've seen/had it, so might as well review it. :) 

Slightly hazy orange-amber, with light, creamy, off-white head. 

Smell is candied citrus rind - mostly orange, a deep, rich, rounded pine smell, toffee, and a sweet, bread+honey malt aroma. 

Taste is similar to aroma, but milder, and more evenly balanced.Starts with a syrupy orange flavor, followed by light pine, then a blend of toffee,bread , and floral & herbal hop flavor. Light-moderate bitterness balances the sweeter elements. In actuality, it's probably more bitter than I'm perceiving it, given what it's countering, but it's not that noticeable. 

Feel is medium, initially mildly creamy, becoming lightly prickly as the very,very fine carbonation kicks in. Leaves a syrupy coating on the tongue . 

Overall, thoroughly enjoyable. A classic for a reason. Worth a try . :)Sep 15, 2020", '4When poured from a bottle there is a lacy head with a slightly cloudy amber color. There is a Sweet hop aroma that precedes a taste that follows what you would expect from the aroma. Sweet hops with slight bitter after taste on the pallet that is dulled a bit buy the Sweetness.this is a very good imperial IPA.
A good starter to a relaxing evening .Sep 05, 2020']

['4.25Citrusy and not as bitter as their other ipas still solid bitterness but overal not as much solid beer would definitely drink again if in tap somewhere.Aug 13, 2021', "4.5Beautiful white cap with lots of white lacing. 
Alcohol well masked.
Inexpensive.
I can really taste the wheat then the hops hit but they are just right.
Spent half the glass trying to classify. Did I pour 1/2 wheat beer and 1/2 an IPA?
IDK how to classify this. But I'll have another please! 
-- mid way thru the 2d one- now that I know what to expect it really starts to come into its own. This is one you have to try and I would suggest having more than one.Jul 09, 2021", '4.25Indecipherable code on bottom.
Pretty, golden beer, crystal clear with lazy bubbles wafting to the top. A low white head slumps to a persistent film below flecks of sticky lace.
The aroma is beery in an old school way. Up front malt notes of honey and white sugar followed by floral hops along with the green pine cone thing. Hints of cherries and berries and just a touch of citrus. 
Really well balanced between the sweet and bitter in a medium bodied vehicle. Flavors of wild flower honey and lightly kilned grains blend with sharp and tart hop acids lending a crisp lettuce and black pepper character. Smoothly drinable and refreshing, the wheat giving a unique compliment to the firm bitterness.
The finish is long with lingering pepper and alcohol burps.
Not bad at all for a mass production (by craft standards anyway) beer sold singly in a tall boy can for @$4.Jul 05, 2021', '4.25Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small head with light lacing. 

Smells of piney hops. 

Tastes of hops and malt with a wheat tang to it. There are also light pineapple and citrus tastes. Has a slightly bitter hop finish. 

Medium body with light carbonation. Clean dry mouthfeel. 

This is a very drinkable hop forward brew.Jun 13, 2021', '4This is one of those beers I've had a lot before but never gotten round to reviewing it. Here goes:

A: Poured from the 12oz can into a pint glass. The beer is a clear golden color with a slightly off-white head with low retention.

S: Slightly sweet, slightly soapy. Honey, caramel malt, and a solid malt backbone. Hop profile ha light pine and some citrus, but less in-your-face than some IPAs.

T: Balance and a light sweetness are the first impressions. Light citrus and apple. Tastes really fresh and bright. Pineapple tempered by a light bitterness. Malt profile has plenty of sweetness and bread. Smooth and slightly dry.

Overall: This is a super drinkable beer. Smooth, tasty, fresh. True that it is hard to put your finger on - not quite an IPA (in the typical sense), but not sure what else to call it. How about just "good."Jun 02, 2021', '4The smooth feel is great, this is definitely a good brew, a taste the alcohol a weeeeee bit but overall a pretty good beer for sure. Good hop aroma and flavor and idk the smoothness is definitely notedMay 24, 2021', '4.512oz can dated 3/25/21 poured into a Teku on 5/2/21.

Pours 1" of bubbly white head. A golden, slightly translucent color.

Aromas of faint pine, dank grass, sweet malt, and a little booze.

Pine and herbal flavors are well balanced with sweet malt flavors. A crisp wheat flavor as well.

Medium-bodied mouthfeel, astringent and effervescent. Not too dry, oily or sticky. Smooth and refreshing.

A delicious, well-balanced, easy drinking IPA.May 23, 2021', "4.5Bought a month old 6 pack of bottles and poured this fresh brew into my 14.2 ounce Teku beer glass..Presented a beautiful 2 finger thick carbonated rich head, and had a beautiful copper gold tint with a slight amber glow. 

Langunitas always seem to do a great job on there dates and quality control and did a superb job with this one..I'm getting pineapple/grapefruit, with a slight smack of caramel creaminess to even every thing out..

The smell is nice and hoppy, with pine notes that come through with a slight wheat soaked wood smell that resonates off each sip of this well done American IPA..I'm definitely a fan of Langunitas and this is one of my favorites from them..

Last but not least, this brew goes down like silk, even at 7.5..There is absolutely no alcohol burn with this one..May 14, 2021", "4Look: Pours a translucent bright yellow with a quarter finger, eggshell white head. Excellent lacing.

Aroma: Pungent overripened spicy grapefruit and sweet orange with very, very slight hints of white bread. Not to undersell the aroma; although it's strong, I'm not getting much else besides grapefruit and orange. A little one dimensional.

Taste: Clean and dry. Bitter pine sap upfront complimented by a gentle sugar cookie flavor. Underlying hints of orange and grapefruit peel. Tropical but very dry. I don't know if it's just my imagination but I'm also getting notes of coffee? It's way in the back on the finish. Obviously not a straight black coffee flavor , more of a latté or cappuccino + cream taste.

Feel: Medium bodied. High carbonation. 7.5% ABV is well hidden.

Overall: Strange (in a good way). It's hearty and rich, boozy almost - yet well balanced, mildly sessionable and well carbonated.Apr 15, 2021", '4355 ml bottle, from Ølkonsortiet, Aalborg. ABV is 7.5%. 64.2 IBU, OG 1076. Golden colour, large white head. Very nice sweetish and fruity aroma, notes of American hops and pale crystal malts, hints of fresh orange marmalade. The flavour has a nice hoppiness throughout, but is unfortunately a bit too sweet for my taste. Bitter finish. Well worth sampling. Rerate: Bottle in California. Found it not too sweet this time. Very good beer.Mar 22, 2021', '3.75Pretty straight forward and standard American IPA, but not quite in the upper eschelons. It's a little "soapy" on the tongue, it has light airy bubbles that when combined with the bitterness can be off-putting if you're not used to drinking IPAs. It has a proper alcohol level at 7.5%, and goes down smooth with a nice effervescence.Mar 18, 2021', '4Clear bright golden amber body sporting a large white head along with good lacing. Subtle but pleasant aroma, bready, slightly floral. The taste of hops take a step forward then back again while doing a two-step with the malts. Beauty in the balance. Aftertaste on the spicier side. Smooth, medium bodied mouthfeel with an average length finish.Mar 15, 2021', "4.25I have been eyeing this IPA for a while now and glad to finally come around to it. Right away the head is huge, uniform bubbles, large and frothy. Pearly white. There is just a slight ale fog, but mostly translucent. A bright gold. Orange lemon frosting, bread crusts and grass. There are a ridiculous range of hops here, every note of IPA. Dominantly candied orange ending piney. Rather juicy. Very soft and full. Sweet biscuit, orange scone, and clean lemon finish. Forest notes.
This is such a complex brew with a multitude of scents and flavors all mingling together. It is whatever IPA you prefer. Northwest pine, New England orange juice, West Coast bitter. I couldn't turn it down.Mar 03, 2021", '4.25It had been a while since I had this beer. Not sure why I didn’t review it before. These days I usually buy Super Cluster ad my default Lagunitas but felt like something different. Very pleasantly surprised with this beer. It has great taste and feel. I like it as a winter beer when you’re not feeling like a juice bomb hazy and just want a solid hoppy beer with good mouthfeel and a nice bitter finish. Loving this right now and will definitely buy more since it’s only $10 for a six pack of 12 oz cans.Mar 02, 2021', "4Overall a very solid beer. Laces nicely with a good head (although its color is somewhat forgettable). Get a bit of wheaty malt smell in the nose but not much else. Wheat really comes out in the front with teh hops coming in at the middle. Maltiness stays in the back. Overall it's an interesting and well-executed flavor that I'm not sure I love. Feel is smooth but not too light. Overall a good beer that I'd recommend if you're feeling a bit more adventurous but want to stay in the IPA world. Won't blow your socks off though.Mar 02, 2021", '4.5Poured into a Riedel IPA beer glass given to me by my cousin-in-law from Chicago.
Smooth, aromatic, and delicious; this IPA is one of the best I’ve tried. Highly recommended; purchased at Walmart for $19.99 for a twelve pack bottles.Feb 13, 2021', '4.25I’ve been drinking this for a few years and can’t believe I hadn’t reviewed it. 
Look: Dark gold/orange, mostly clear, cream colored head. 
Smell: Not as aromatic as some, there’s some citrus and a slight brown sugary smell that I get. 
Taste: Mostly citrus hops with some pine in the backend. Very slight sweetness. A little intense hop bitterness on the finish as you’d expect at 60+ IBU’s, but not overwhelming. 
Mouthfeel: Mostly dry, there’s no cloying sweetness that some IPA’s have to counteract the hops. You won’t know it’s 7.5 ABV until you’re half way thru a 19.2oz can.Jan 25, 2021', '4.75Crystal clear deep gold, nice white head with great retention and lace.
Black currant, muscadine grape, ruby red grapefruit, a hint of pine.
Tastes like it smells, underlying bready malt
Medium-light bodied with appropriate carbonation
Forgot how good this one is. Needs to get back into my regular rotation.Jan 25, 2021', "4.2512 can with 255 code

Clear golden color with one finger's white head. Partial cap with large bubbled, partial lacing curtains.
Orange, pine, floral hop aromas
Light pine, pineapple, orange, white pepper, lime, lemon zest flavors
Smooth light feel with a hop tingle developing across the tongue, no alcohol heat, good carbonation.
A great hop and malt combination, consistent quality, a year around favorite.Jan 10, 2021", "4It smells fruity and hoppy but like the asshole of Maximus or Hop Stoopid. Still the smell is good.

It tastes extremely hoppy but without irony it is incredibly grape fruity and fresh.

The mouthfeel is foamy and smooth but the finish is bitter with a lot of hops.
