The yeasty elements are dialed-back, so might be a good introduction to the style for those that might find those things off-putting at first.Oct 18, 2020', "4.5Look: Pours a really beautiful looking opaque, hazy orange/yellow with a big frothy two finger eggshell colored head. Laces the glass exceptionally well.

Aroma: Very mild. Fresh hay. Faintest notion of bubblegum/banana, a touch of clove and honey.

Taste: Very clean and refreshing. Shredded wheat (the cereal), honey and bananas. A hint of vanilla cream. A mild, peppery cilantro or parsley note adds a nice hoppy bite to the finish. Quite impressive - the flavor is simple but exceptionally tasty. Very easy drinking.

Feel: Creamy and full bodied. Low-mid carbonation. Extremely thirst quenching and sessionable.

Overall: Simple and refreshing but at the same time heady and rich. Really impressed with this. You'll be hard pressed to find a better hefeweizen.Sep 28, 2020", "4Notes about the brew:

It’s the #1 wheat beer in Germany and one of the world’s favorites. In fact, beer experts call it a masterpiece. In developing this beer, the Paulaner brewmasters have perfected a unique technique with “yeast suspension,” resulting in a uniform, slightly cloudy appearance, consistent quality, and perfect taste.

Appearance - Pours a cloudy gold with five fingers of frothy moussy white head.

Smell - noble earthy and leafy hops, bubblegum aromas, clove, pepper, banana, bready and grainy malts, and earthy yeast.

Taste - noble earthy and leafy hops upfront. The bubblegum aromas, clove, pepper, and banana follow suit and are nicely balanced. The bready/grainy malts and earthy yeast round out the brew. 

Mouthfeel - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Finishes creamy with all elements lingering. 

Overall - A pleasant hefe from the true source of wheat beers. It's nice to see how well this brew can stand up to some of the best hefe's made by several craft breweries. A nice treat to find here in Cowtown!Sep 27, 2020", "42020-08-29
500ml can served in a SIP Fest 2020 snulip. Apparently canned on 11.17.2019, best by 11.17.2020.

looks hazy light amber with a nice sized head and plenty of carbonation. Smell is mildly grainy, a little banana, sweet, pleasant.

Taste is lots of grain and definitely some banana. Rich and full, but not in-your-face. Slight spiciness.

Mouthfeel is medium but quite effervescent. Overall, nice beer -- I've considered this the best hefeweizen I know for many years, and I think it's better fresher.Aug 30, 2020", '4Appearance - cloudy, hazy, golden color with white head

Smell - cloves, banana bread

Taste - clove, banana bread, orange peel, wheat

Mouthfeel - medium bodied, medium carbonation, clove upfront, wheat and banana bread on the back end

Overall - Not quite at the head of the class for the style, but good nonetheless. Worth a try.

Price Point - $7.99/ 4 pack, 16 oz cansAug 08, 2020', '4.511.2oz bottle poured into a 12oz glass. Pours a cloudy deep yellow, two finger head, nice lacing. Smell is cloves and sweet malt. Overall, I’m not super familiar with this style, but it’s as good of a Hefeweizen as I’ve had before.Jul 26, 2020', '4Poured from 330ml bottle into pint glass. A 2"+ pillowy off white head drops slowly with abundant lacing. Color is cloudy yellow-orange. Aroma of banana and bubble gum yeast with a grainy backbone and little hop presence. Mouthfeel is highly carbonated and crisp with a dry somewhat astringent finish. Flavors of wheat bread, cracker, lemon. Overall: excellent within the style.Jul 25, 2020', '4.25Very nice Hefeweizen - I rated this one a bit higher than Erdinger, and substantially higher than Schneider Weisse. But they are very similar Hefe renditions - both are very refreshing and satisfying.Jul 25, 2020', '3.75From the bottle in a pint glass. This legacy brewery brew pours
a nice hazed and cloudy amber tinged golden color with a

with subtle honey sweet malts....what happened to the banana?
Flavors show faint banana, soft wheat, subtle herbal hops, and

carbonation, and finishing with a light sweet wheat note.

This has changed so much from what it once was....my go to hefe 
is now one I can pass on which is heart breaking. The sweetness

Wheat ale.Jul 10, 2020', '1.25This beer was one of most loves wheat German in Russia for about last 5-7 years! 2013 -2020! But now, the Paulaner company have change standarts brewering... I think. June 15 2020Jun 16, 2020", '4opaque orange color with good white head and decent retention. Smell banana a lot and a slight yeasty fruitiness. Somehow it smells creamy like when your nose is close to a milkshake and tastes creamy in the mouthfeel too. Solid, classic hefeweizen.Jun 10, 2020']

['4.25Lovely golden color. Banana and clove nose. Lively when poured from can into glass. This was a perfect balance.Aug 29, 2021', "4.5The gold standard of Hefeweizen/Weissbiers. Every characteristic that people associate with weissbier is here. This is the first weissbier that made other people's talk of bubblegum and clove tastes really resonate with me because this one really has them. Overall an excellent beer. The only question that remains is who did it better, Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier, or Schneider Weisse Original? Time for a head to headAug 23, 2021", "5This beer tastes like banana bread dipped in bubble gum ice cream, and the bottle is glorious. On Tap at Sabatini's, Exeter PA.

Looks splendid in the tall Weihenstephan glass. Cloudy bright amber body, generous white head, excellent lacing. 

malty, a hint of spice, some banana

On tasting, excellent balance, nothing dominates, reaching quickly for the next mouthful.

Mouth above medium, finish wheaty with a little banana & spice. 

Overall, the gold standard for the style.Aug 17, 2021", '4.25Pours a hazy straw color with a big fluffy white head. Banana and spice on the nose as well as taste. A very refreshing and tasty beverage...a classic!Jul 27, 2021', '4.5Appearance - Cloudy, golden, with a tall, full, thick, white head. Looks beautiful in a weizen glass.
Smell - Cloves and banana detected first followed by a mildly sweet biscuit aroma.
Taste - Cloves and banana are prominent but in proper proportions. A touch of wheat-ish sweetness with a small bitterness to balance the taste well. Cinnamon is barely detectable but in there. Finishes clean and easy.
Mouthfeel - Not as heavy as the thick head would indicate but appropriately smooth and full. Leaves a light, even coat.
Overall - I am not a fan of the style but this is certainly one of the best examples. Unlike many other hefeweizens, this one doesn’t possess overpowering yeast smell and flavor or excessive sweetness that turns me off of so many others. I can certainly see why it is so highly regarded.Jul 11, 2021', "5I can't think of a single reason to take even a fraction of a point from this beer's ranking. This beer IS the holotype for a cloudy wheat beer with extensive fruit and grain flavours. You might have a preference for other wheat beers. You might not like wheat beers. But this is the one against which all others should be measured.

It is a cloudy blond in appearance. Pours a tight white head that is dense and holds. Leaves ample lacing. It has very strong fruit aromas, particularly banana esters, but with balancing spice. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy and the spice lingers on the palate.Jul 08, 2021", '4Strong flavors of banana and grain, along with an almost medicinal spice. More bready than a belgian wit, and just the right amount of refreshing. This one has staying power.Jul 02, 2021', '3From the back label "2061 09:31:25"

Appearance: The body is nearly opaque with a gummi-like transparency that allows deep and fuzzy shadows through but no defining images. There isn't much of a head. It has a short creamy-textured film with sparse bubbles but nothing serious. It is noticeably uninspiring visually-wise; the lack of a substantial head, even when forced from the bottle pour, is disappointing.

Aroma: It smells of clove and old cardboard with a note of burnt pizza crust.

Taste: Under-ripe banana comes through at first and it's really bright tasting. The middle of the palate is a mellow banana flavor and a faint cream of wheat flavor. It's pleasant but very mellow. It invokes memories of sliced bananas over shredded wheat cereal. It has a very nice, clean, precisely flavored finish which consists of green bananas and wheat cereal.

Mouthfeel: It is well carbonated and light bodied. It is easy to drink. No real bitterness.

Overall: An uncomplicated beer with a nice banana flavor with a note of cereal wheat. As an import beer this is alright and it's worth drinking from time to time. It has some very intriguing and unique banana flavors, however it lacks complexity. I could drink it again but I would likely hesitate at a bottle over a keg pour. I would love to try it fresher than an import bottle.Jun 18, 2021', '4.25Mildly cloudy, light amber body; gentle, slow-rising carbonation; very thick, dense and creamy head, white. Full, rounded mouthfeel, heavy body; chewy and velvety on the palate.

This beer certainly reminds me of the hefeweisens I enjoyed in Germany. Still, I think this one is a little old, but the appearance and, especially, the mouthfeel are there.

Poured at 55° F; bottle dating info: 23 60Jun 18, 2021', '5This is my favorite beer I’ve ever had. If you like a true hefeweissbier this is the beer for you. Brewed under the Bavarian purity law of course. I also like the crystal version a lot!Jun 16, 2021', "4.5Poured from 11.2 oz bottle into pint glass.
A: Bright golden/yellow,slightly hazy, holds a pillowy 1/2 inch white head.
S: Banana,banana,banana with a hint of clove.
T: banana,clove,cereal maltiness
M: med-light body, carbonation tickles the tongue,
O: The standard for all Hefe's to follow AND The OG summer brew.May 02, 2021", "4.75Purchased as a six-pack from a Marathon for $12.99. Poured into a weizen glass.

L - A brilliantly cloudy goldenrod with a steady 3-finger white head.
S - Clove, banana, bubblegum, and freshly-baked bread. Hinting at a mellow hoppiness.
T - Banana and clove is strong in this one! Banana bread, butter, and a nice barley base. Sweet, but not overwhelming.
F - Chewy, yet clean. Lightly carbonated. A slight alcohol warmth towards the bottom.
O - Hefeweizen brewers, this is the definitive hefe. A humble beer that knows what it has. Drink this with traditional German fare, and you'll be in for a larger treat than just drinking it on its own - which is still a very decent experience! Outstanding in the style, owed mostly to its simplicity. Will buy again.Apr 15, 2021", '4.5Poured from a 16.9 oz can bb date of 11/20/21 5.4 abv
Huge creamy white above the rim head, crystal clear golden yellow color

Nose was banana, hint of cloves and wheat. A bit bready/ yeasty

Mouthfeel is kind of chunky, kind of sweet but not sticky, medium carbonation that tickles the tongue up front and a smooth wet finish that kind of coats your mouth 

Overall this is not a style I drink often but of the ones I’ve had, this one is definitely well crafted and an excellent representation of the styleMar 28, 2021', "4.25L: Pours a cloudy/hazy light orange color with a massive off-white head with good retention.

It's a good beer, a little different, but not outstanding. Didn't quite meet the 'World Class' expectation, but then this is a style I'm not familiar with. Hope it'll grow on me.

After I finished that beer, it suggested that it wasn't so bad after all, kind of interesting, and I should have another. So I did. I love the way this beer holds it's head, and I love the feeling of sipping the beer through that silky frothy head. And the taste grew on me. This may have just become a favorite change of pace. It's the far end of the spectrum from IPAs and porters. I think maybe I found a new favorite style.Mar 19, 2021", '3.75(500 ml bottle). Overall: Industry standard HefeMar 09, 2021', "4.5Total amateur review: I enjoyed this beer for Sunday breakfast at my aunt's in Füssen whilst recovering from an illness. This was the first hefe I tried, and nothing quite compares to it. The hints of banana, perfect carbonation and a wonderful smell create a great beer.
